TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit SyndicationContent extends System.Object

Docs.summary: A base class that represents syndication content.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is an abstract class and cannot be instantiated directly. It is used as the base class for the following syndication content types:
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.UrlSyndicationContent>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.XmlSyndicationContent>

.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent source) cil managed

Docs.param: The instance to use to initialize the new instance.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary<System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName,string> AttributeExtensions { get; }
.property instance class System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2<class System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName, string> AttributeExtensions

Docs.summary: Gets the attribute extensions for this content.
Docs.value: A dictionary that contains the attribute extensions for this object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. The syndication object model allows you to add custom attributes to a syndication content type (for example, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent>). When serialized to Atom 1.0, these attributes appear within the `<content>` element. When serialized to RSS 2.0, these attribute are ignored.
## Examples The following XML shows how a custom attribute added to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent> instance is serialized to Atom 1.0.
``` <content type="text" customAttribute="value">Some text content</content> ```

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract string Type { get; }
.property instance string Type

Docs.value: The name of the type of syndication content.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is abstract, so it must be accessed on an instance of a syndication content type (a class derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent>). The .NET Framework defines the following syndication content types:
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.UrlSyndicationContent>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.XmlSyndicationContent>
- This class contains a number of static helper methods for creating the various types of syndication content:
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent.CreateHtmlContent%28System.String%29>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent.CreatePlaintextContent%28System.String%29>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent.CreateUrlContent%28System.Uri%2CSystem.String%29>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent.CreateXhtmlContent%28System.String%29>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent.CreateXmlContent%28System.Object%29>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent.CreateXmlContent%28System.Object%2CSystem.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer%29>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent.CreateXmlContent%28System.Object%2CSystem.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer%29>
